info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 12:31PM EDT until April 8 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Yellow River at Plymouth affecting St. Joseph, Starke and Marshall Counties.
For the Yellow River...including Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Yellow River at Plymouth.
* WHEN...From Friday afternoon to late Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Some residential and commercial properties near the Jefferson Street Bridge begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EDT Thursday /10:45 AM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 13.1 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall to flood stage early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 13.7 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 645 AM EDT /545 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Marshall, IN; St. Joseph, IN; Starke, IN
